com.ibm.avatar.api

Class CompileAQL

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.api.CompileAQL

  • public class CompileAQL
extends Object
    This class provides APIs to compile both modular and non-modular AQL files. The AQL files are read from the local filesystem, and written back into the local filesystem as compiled module files. Modular AQL files are compiled into Text Analytics Module files named after the module name, as in <moduleName>.tam. Non-modular AQL files are compiled into genericModule.tam
    This class can also be invoked through its main(String[]) method. For sample usage, invoke the main() method with no arguments.
    Note: Presently, there is no support for compiling AQL source code stored in a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS).

    WARNING: Support for non-modular AQL is retained for backward compatibility. However, it may be removed in a future release.

      • compile

        public static CompilationSummary compile(CompileAQLParams params)
                                  throws CompilerException,
                                         TextAnalyticsException
        Compiles both modular and non-modular AQLs and writes the compiled modules(in TAM file format) to the location returned by CompileAQLParams.getOutputURI(). For modular AQLs, the source of the AQL module(s) to compile is specified through the CompileAQLParams.setInputModules(String[]) API. For non-modular AQLs, the source is specified through CompileAQLParams.setInputFile(File) or the CompileAQLParams.setInputStr(String) API, depending upon whether the top-level AQL is contained in a File or a String. Compilation of modular and non-modular AQLs is mutually exclusive; that is, both modular and non-modular AQLs cannot be compiled together. Non-modular AQLs are compiled into a special compiled module called 'genericModule'.
        Parameters:
        params - parameters specifying the input, output, and various flags used during compilation
        Returns:
        a CompilationSummary object containing: name of modules compiled, total number of views compiled, and all the encountered compilation warnings
        Throws:
        CompilerException - for checked exceptions that occur during the compile phase
        TextAnalyticsException - for unchecked exceptions
